thread.title: A beautiful Friday Fall Fest forecast
thread.title_full: A beautiful Friday Fall Fest forecast

author: Gunnar Consol
title: A beautiful Friday Fall Fest forecast
text:
TODAY:
82° & SUNNY
After a cool/mild start to the day, things will be warming up nicely into the afternoon due to southerly winds.
Without cloud cover once the sun warms things up it'll feel a bit toasty but not too bad especially if you can find some shade.
But a beautiful evening tonight. Post sunset Fall-Fest conditions will be the warmest they've been so far so not needing to worry about layering up too much.
But a beautiful evening tonight. Post sunset Fall-Fest conditions will be the warmest they've been so far so not needing to worry about layering up too much.
Clear conditions so if we have the chance to see the aurora borealis again we'll at least see great viewing conditions. If we don't, at least a great opportunity to stargaze.
TOMORROW:
86° & SUNNY
Our Saturday will be perfect for Fall Fest's last day. It'll be dry and some clouds will actually filter in and out helping the sun to not feel like it's beating down quite as much. Just be prepared for a hot day regardless of the clouds providing some shade. Only a few degrees from the 90s. At least no humidity.
SUNDAY:
54° / 82° & SUNNY
Slightly cooler for our Sunday with temperatures not as hot with temperatures in the low 80s.
No chance for rain but a cold front will bring noticeably cooler conditions for our Sunday evening and overnight.
NEXT WEEK:
40s→30s / 60s & SUNNY
After the passage of that Sunday cold front, things will be much cooler for our Monday and rest of week.
Our high temperatures most of next week will be in the 60s! We may even see our first frosty lows with lows in the 30s.
Our high temperatures most of next week will be in the 60s! We may even see our first frosty lows with lows in the 30s.
